intro: Tiarella cordifolia subsp. austrina, commonly known as the Australian foamflower, is a perennial herb native to eastern Australia. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, white fuzzy coating. The plant produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking shade-tolerant plants.
